text: Warren's Opera House is a historic building in Friend, Nebraska. It was built by John Lanahan for Joshua Warren in 1885–1886. With Inside, there is an auditorium with a proscenium and a balcony supported by four columns. It hosted performances by "touring stock companies; comic opera; companies; musical concerts; dialect comedies" as well as local performers and Memorial Day celebrations. The building has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since September 28, 1988. ==References== Category:1885 establishments in Nebraska Category:Commercial buildings completed in 1885 Category:National Register of Historic Places in Saline County, Nebraska Category:Opera houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Nebraska
title: Warren's Opera House
